00017 package Apache::WeBWorK;
00018 
00019 =head1 NAME
00020 
00021 Apache::WeBWorK - mod_perl handler for WeBWorK 2.
00022 
00023 =head1 CONFIGURATION
00024 
00025 This module should be installed as a Handler for the location selected for
00026 WeBWorK on your webserver. Refer to the file F<conf/webwork.apache-config> for
00027 details.
00028 
00029 =cut
00030 
00031 use strict;
00032 use warnings;
00033 use HTML::Entities;
00034 use Date::Format;
00035 use WeBWorK;
00036 
00037 use mod_perl;
00038 use constant MP2 => ( exists $ENV{MOD_PERL_API_VERSION} and $ENV{MOD_PERL_API_VERSION} >= 2 );
00039 
00040 # load correct modules
00041 BEGIN {
00042     if (MP2) {
00043         require Apache2::Log;
00044         Apache2::Log->import;
00045     } else {
00046         require Apache::Log;
00047         Apache::Log->import;
00048     }
00049 }
00050 
00051 ################################################################################
00052 
00053 =head1 APACHE REQUEST HANDLER
00054 
00055 =over
00056 
00057 =item handler($r)
00058 
00059 =cut
00060 
00061 sub handler($) {
00062     my ($r) = @_;
00063     my $log = $r->log;
00064     my $uri = $r->uri;
00065     
00066     # the warning handler accumulates warnings in $r->notes("warnings") for
00067     # later cumulative reporting
00068     my $warning_handler;
00069     if (MP2) {
00070         $warning_handler = sub {
00071             my ($warning) = @_;
00072             chomp $warning;
00073             
00074             my $warnings = $r->notes->get("warnings");
00075             $warnings .= "$warning\n";
00076             #my $backtrace = join("\n",backtrace());
00077             #$warnings .= "$backtrace\n\n";
00078             $r->notes->set(warnings => $warnings);
00079             
00080             $log->warn("[$uri] $warning");
00081         };
00082     } else {
00083         $warning_handler = sub {
00084             my ($warning) = @_;
00085             chomp $warning;
00086             
00087             my $warnings = $r->notes("warnings");
00088             $warnings .= "$warning\n";
00089             #my $backtrace = join("\n",backtrace());
00090             #$warnings .= "$backtrace\n\n";
00091             $r->notes("warnings" => $warnings);
00092             
00093             $log->warn("[$uri] $warning");
00094         };
00095         
00096         # the exception handler generates a backtrace when catching an exception
00097         my @backtrace;
00098         my $exception_handler = sub {
00099             @backtrace = backtrace();
00100             die @_;
00101         };
00102     }
00103     
00104     # the exception handler generates a backtrace when catching an exception
00105     my @backtrace;
00106     my $exception_handler = sub {
00107         @backtrace = backtrace();
00108         die @_;
00109     };
00110     
00111     my $result = do {
00112         local $SIG{__WARN__} = $warning_handler;
00113         local $SIG{__DIE__} = $exception_handler;
00114         
00115         eval { WeBWorK::dispatch($r) };
00116     };
00117     
00118     if ($@) {
00119         my $exception = $@;
00120         
00121         my $warnings = MP2 ? $r->notes->get("warnings") : $r->notes("warnings");
00122         my $htmlMessage = htmlMessage($r, $warnings, $exception, @backtrace);
00123         unless ($r->bytes_sent) {
00124             $r->content_type("text/html");
00125             $r->send_http_header unless MP2; # not needed for Apache2
00126             $htmlMessage = "<html><body>$htmlMessage</body></html>";
00127         }
00128         print $htmlMessage;
00129         
00130         # log the error to the apache error log
00131         my $textMessage = textMessage($r, $warnings, $exception, @backtrace);
00132         $log->error($textMessage);
00133     }
00134     
00135     return $result;
00136 }
00137 
00138 =back
00139 
00140 =cut
00141 
00142 ################################################################################
00143 
00144 =head1 ERROR HANDLING ROUTINES
00145 
00146 =over
00147 
00148 =item backtrace()
00149 
00150 Produce a stack-frame traceback for the calls up through the ones in
00151 Apache::WeBWorK.
00152 
00153 =cut
00154 
00155 sub backtrace {
00156     my $frame = 2;
00157     my @trace;
00158     
00159     while (my ($pkg, $file, $line, $subname) = caller($frame++)) {
00160         last if $pkg eq "Apache::WeBWorK";
00161         push @trace, "in $subname called at line $line of $file";
00162     }
00163     
00164     return @trace;
00165 }
00166 
00167 =back
00168 
00169 =cut
00170 
00171 ################################################################################
00172 
00173 =head1 ERROR OUTPUT FUNCTIONS
00174 
00175 =over
00176 
00177 =item htmlMessage($r, $warnings, $exception, @backtrace)
00178 
00179 Format a message for HTML output reporting an exception, backtrace, and any
00180 associated warnings.
00181 
00182 =cut
00183 
00184 sub htmlMessage($$$@) {
00185     my ($r, $warnings, $exception, @backtrace) = @_;
00186     
00187     $warnings = htmlEscape($warnings);
00188     $exception = htmlEscape($exception);
00189     
00190     my @warnings = defined $warnings ? split m|&lt;br /&gt;|, $warnings : ();  #fragile
00191     $warnings = htmlWarningsList(@warnings);
00192     my $backtrace = htmlBacktrace(@backtrace);
00193     
00194     my $admin = ($ENV{SERVER_ADMIN}
00195         ? " (<a href=\"mailto:$ENV{SERVER_ADMIN}\">$ENV{SERVER_ADMIN}</a>)"
00196         : "");
00197     my $time = time2str("%a %b %d %H:%M:%S %Y", time);
00198     my $method = htmlEscape( $r->method  );
00199     my $uri = htmlEscape(  $r->uri );
00200     my $headers = do {
00201         my %headers = MP2 ? %{$r->headers_in} : $r->headers_in;
00202         join("", map { "<tr><td><small>" . htmlEscape($_). "</small></td><td><small>" .
00203                         htmlEscape($headers{$_}) . " </small></td></tr>" } keys %headers);
00204     };
00205     
00206     return <<EOF;
00207 <div style="text-align:left">
00208  <h2>WeBWorK error</h2>
00209  <p>An error occured while processing your request. For help, please send mail
00210  to this site's webmaster$admin, including all of the following information as
00211  well as what what you were doing when the error occured.</p>
00212  <p>$time</p>
00213  <h3>Warning messages</h3>
00214  <ul>$warnings</ul>
00215  <h3>Error messages</h3>
00216  <blockquote style="color:red"><code>$exception</code></blockquote>
00217  <h3>Call stack</h3>
00218    <p>The information below can help locate the source of the problem.</p>
00219    <ul>$backtrace</ul>
00220  <h3>Request information</h3>
00221  <table border="1">
00222   <tr><td>Method</td><td>$method</td></tr>
00223   <tr><td>URI</td><td>$uri</td></tr>
00224   <tr><td>HTTP Headers</td><td>
00225    <table width="90%">
00226     $headers
00227    </table>
00228   </td></tr>
00229  </table>
00230 </div>
00231 EOF
00232 }
00233 
00234 =item textMessage($r, $warnings, $exception, @backtrace)
00235 
00236 Format a message for HTML output reporting an exception, backtrace, and any
00237 associated warnings.
00238 
00239 =cut
00240 
00241 sub textMessage($$$@) {
00242     my ($r, $warnings, $exception, @backtrace) = @_;
00243     
00244     #my @warnings = defined $warnings ? split m/\n+/, $warnings : ();
00245     #$warnings = textWarningsList(@warnings);
00246     chomp $exception;
00247     my $backtrace = textBacktrace(@backtrace);
00248     my $uri = $r->uri;
00249     
00250     return "[$uri] $exception\n$backtrace";
00251 }
00252 
00253 =item htmlBacktrace(@frames)
00254 
00255 Formats a list of stack frames in a backtrace as list items for HTML output.
00256 
00257 =cut
00258 
00259 sub htmlBacktrace(@) {
00260     my (@frames) = @_;
00261     foreach my $frame (@frames) {
00262         $frame = htmlEscape($frame);
00263         $frame = "<li><code>$frame</code></li>";
00264     }
00265     return join "\n", @frames;
00266 }
00267 
00268 =item textBacktrace(@frames)
00269 
00270 Formats a list of stack frames in a backtrace as list items for text output.
00271 
00272 =cut
00273 
00274 sub textBacktrace(@) {
00275     my (@frames) = @_;
00276     foreach my $frame (@frames) {
00277         $frame = " * $frame";
00278     }
00279     return join "\n", @frames;
00280 }
00281 
00282 =item htmlWarningsList(@warnings)
00283 
00284 Formats a list of warning strings as list items for HTML output.
00285 
00286 =cut
00287 
00288 sub htmlWarningsList(@) {
00289     my (@warnings) = @_;
00290     foreach my $warning (@warnings) {
00291         $warning = htmlEscape($warning);
00292         $warning = "<li><code>$warning</code></li>";
00293     }
00294     return join "\n", @warnings;
00295 }
00296 
00297 =item textWarningsList(@warnings)
00298 
00299 Formats a list of warning strings as list items for text output.
00300 
00301 =cut
00302 
00303 sub textWarningsList(@) {
00304     my (@warnings) = @_;
00305     foreach my $warning (@warnings) {
00306         $warning = " * $warning";
00307     }
00308     return join "\n", @warnings;
00309 }
00310 
00311 =item htmlEscape($string)
00312 
00313 Protect characters that would be interpreted as HTML entities. Then, replace
00314 line breaks with HTML "<br />" tags.
00315 
00316 =cut
00317 
00318 sub htmlEscape($) {
00319     my ($string) = @_;
00320     $string = encode_entities($string);
00321     $string =~ s|\n|<br />|g;
00322     return $string;
00323 }
00324 
00325 =back
00326 
00327 =cut
